gov.usgs.anss.edgemom

Class RawInputSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.edgethread.EdgeThread
        • gov.usgs.anss.edgemom.RawInputSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class RawInputSocket
extends EdgeThread
    RawInputSocket.java - This reads from a socket data in "RawInput" format. This is just a 36 byte header with leadin, seedname, timing, flags, number of samples, etc. followed by "in-the-clear" data samples. The data thus obtained are then written via the RawToMiniSeed.addTimeseries() to enter the data into the edge files. Times of I/O are kept so that sockets and objects can be freed if stale. If configured for out-of-order data the OutOfOrderRTMS class is used to process the data to MiniSeed. All of the configuration of this class is done by the RawInputServer that creates it. See that class for more detail on the configuration options.

    Note: this class is never configured directly into an EdgeMom instance. It is always created by a RawInputServer. Created on August 8, 2005, 3:12 PM

    • Constructor Detail

      • RawInputSocket

        public RawInputSocket(java.net.Socket ss,
              boolean outOfOrder,
              int oorInterval,
              EdgeThread par,
              ChannelSender cs,
              int rsize,
              boolean hyd,
              boolean inorder,
              boolean sockLog,
              boolean rawSend,
              double rawMaxRate)
        Creates a new instance of RawInputSocket
        Parameters:
        ss - The socket to use for this object
        outOfOrder - If true, data on this port is expected out of order (Please set oorInterver>0)
        oorInterval - The expected out of order intval in seconds for the OutOfOrder class.
        par - An edgethread "parent" to use for logging.
        cs - A channel sender for sending data to holdings
        rsize - A desired minimum input buffer size
        hyd - If true, data is sent to hydra.
        inorder - The data is always in order, so Hydra can be sent directly rather than thru an OutputInfraStructure
        sockLog - Turn on logging of the socket read
        rawSend - If true, Send data to OutputInfrastructure as a raw packet
        rawMaxRate - the maximum data rate to include in any Raw Sends

      • run

        public void run()
        This reads from the socket to an RTS, aligns the packet, and forwards it to The indicated IP/port as a UDP packet Note that if the socket goes "bad" this routine just waits for it to be made good through a call to reopen. Termination is only if the connection is down forever or during shutdown situations
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
